location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the first folio with 1 and terminates at the last folio with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The memorandum consists of eight entries on various telegraph lines running through Persia. Each entry outlines who is responsible for it (if anyone), and provides a brief overview of its development and its current status. The lines included are as follows:the Mekran [Makran] line;the Bushire-Tehran-Khanikin [Khānaqīn] line;the Central Persian line;the Arabistan lines;the Indo-European Telegraph line from England to Tehran (via Germany and Russia);the Hamadan-Kazvin [Qazvin] line;the Bunder Abbas [Bandar-e ʻAbbās]-Kerman line;the Tehran-Meshed [Mashhad] line;the Meshed-Birjand-Seistan [Sīstān] line.
